page.title: 09St.Catherine's Centenary
page.content: One of the main features of Bramley is St.Catherine's school, which is in Station Road and adjacent to the A281 and the now disused railway line (Guildford to Horsham). 1985 is St Catherine's centenary year. It was founded for the daughters of middle class Church of England families. It is part boarding and part day. To celebrate the centenary we are going to Butlin's Holiday Camp at Bognor. There will be a special Open Day with displays of work and talent. We are having a new Centenary building with a lecture theatre and sixth form rooms. The Centenary is a special event because one hundred years ago St.Catherine's was one of the first schools for girls. There is a Centenary ball and a service at Guildford Cathedral.
